document.title: What is strategic planning for marketing?

seo.title: What is strategic planning for marketing?
seo.description: Join us to find out what strategic planning for marketing is? Why it is so important? And how you can use it to elevate your marketing.

body.raw:
What should be included in a strategic marketing plan?

Everyone is a marketer these days. Just by posting on your favourite social network you are essentially marketing your content to other users, but there are business dangers in this new status duo.

By doing this, everyone assumes they are a good marketer because they got some results, or sold some products. The reality is that marketing is a much more complex subject and strategic planning for marketing, is often neglected by businesses that do not have a dedicated, trained marketer in-house.

In this article, we will break down what strategic planning for marketing is, how to utilise its power and why you need to have a strategy rather than blindly adding to the millions of posts that are generated every day.

  • What is strategic planning for marketing and why do we need it?
  • How does strategic planning work and what should be included in a plan?
  • The benefits of strategic planning for marketing
  • How to create a strategic marketing plan for your business
  • Conclusion

What is strategic planning for marketing and why do we need it?

First and foremost strategic planning for marketing has to come after strategic business planning. Often they can be undertaken together, but in essence, a strategic marketing plan first needs the business goals and objectives to be laid out before planning can commence. If you are unsure of how to create a strategic business plan, please feel free to drop us a line. Once you have your business strategy in place you can move on to create a strategic plan for marketing.

This plan will involve taking the business goals and objectives and filtering them through the lens of the market and consumer. This may involve a research phase, depending on how much insight you already have, and even a revisiting of your brand positioning depending on what business objectives have been set. Our advice would always be to start with the consumer and work to understand how you might be able to achieve your objective.

The next phase of strategic planning for marketing would be to look at channels, segmentation, and messaging. The key to the success of any marketing programme is to reach the right audience, at the right time with messaging that is compelling and promises to solve a pain they have.

The final phase of strategic planning for marketing is then consider phasing, budget allocation, measurement, and KPIs. This phase provides the information and direction for tactical plans to be developed, executed, and monitored.

The key reason for spending time on this important work is to create organisational alignment across the business. Also working through consumer needs, wants, pains and gains are critical to developing cost-effective campaigns that will be profitable to your business.

How does strategic planning work and what should be included in a plan?

Strategic planning for marketing works by first identifying your marketing goals and objectives, and then creating a plan of action that will help you to achieve these goals. Your plan should include all aspects of your marketing mix, from your product or service to your pricing, promotion, and distribution. It should also include a clear timeline of when each element of your marketing mix will be implemented.

The following elements make up the key parts of strategic planning for marketing:

  1. Business summary – What does your company do and what is the overarching mission of the business.
  2. Marketing Audit / Internal Resource Discovery – Internal and external audit of the business to understand its merits, as well as uncover challenges and opportunities.
  3. Goal alignment with business objectives – A restatement of the business objectives and how the marketing objectives dovetail with this. A
  4. External Review – Competitors, Market Environment, Macro factors etc
  5. Target Market – Segmentation and valuable customer buying personas
  6. Positioning Statement – Including customer value proposition(s)
  7. Messaging Hierarchy – How are you going to communicate with different audiences
  8. Key Strategies – How are you going to achieve your objectives through product, price, promotion, people, and process.
  9. Channel Alignment – which channels align themselves with different objectives, audiences, and key strategies.
  10. Budget & Phasing – To which channels and strategies are budgets allocated and key phasing dates to ensure that the business objectives are achieved.
  11. Resource Plan – What key technologies, people, services and skills will be required to deliver the plan at a high level.

The benefits of strategic planning for marketing

There are many benefits of strategic planning for marketing, some of which are outlined below:

  • Helps businesses to focus their resources on achieving their marketing goals
  • Enables businesses to track their progress and measure their success
  • Helps businesses to adapt their strategies as market conditions change
  • Creates a sense of accountability among team members

How to create a strategic marketing plan for your business

Now that we have covered what strategic planning for marketing is, and the many benefits it can offer businesses, let’s take a look at how you can create a strategic marketing plan for your business.

Creating a strategic marketing plan for your business does not have to be a complicated or time-consuming task. Simply follow the steps above and you will be well on your way to developing a successful marketing strategy. However, there are many other routes you could take:

  • Engage a specialist marketing or branding agency
  • Engage a media agency that can undertake some of this work
  • Work with a fractional marketing director
  • Work with a marketing consultancy that specialises in strategic marketing

There are pros and cons to each of these routes, but your budget and the level of integration that you want will determine the best route for your needs.

Conclusion

Strategic planning for marketing is a critical process that helps businesses to focus their resources on achieving their business goals. By auditing your business, understanding your target market, and aligning your strategies with your objectives, you can create a plan that will help you achieve success. There are many benefits of strategic planning for marketing, such as improved tracking of success, the ability to adapt strategies as market conditions change, and making more efficient use of your overall budget. To create a strategic marketing plan for your business, follow the steps above or consider working with a specialist marketing consultancy.

seo.title: What makes a good blog in 2022?
seo.description: Want to know what makes a successful blog in 2022? In this post, we ll outline the key factors you need to consider to make your blog thrive.

body.raw:
How to make your new blog stand out

Introduction

To create a successful blog, it’s important to understand what makes a good blog in 2022. While some things may stay the same, such as providing valuable content and building an audience, there are other factors you’ll need to take into account to make your blog stand out. In this post, we’ll outline what those factors are and how you can make sure your blog is successful.

There are a few key changes that have taken place since 2020 that bloggers need to take into account. First, the way people consume content has changed. People are now more likely to consume content on their mobile devices than on desktop computers. This means that your blog needs to be optimized for mobile devices. Additionally, social media platforms have changed the way they operate, which has impacted bloggers who use those platforms to promote their content. Finally, Google’s algorithms have changed, which means that your blog needs to be more SEO-friendly than ever before.

Choose a topic for your blog and stick with it

When it comes to blogging, one of the most important things you can do is choose a topic and stick with it. By focusing on a specific topic, you’ll be able to provide your readers with valuable content that they can’t find elsewhere. Additionally, by sticking with a specific topic, you’ll be able to build an audience who is interested in what you have to say.

Ensure your blogging platform or CMS is fast and mobile-friendly

Blogging platforms come in all shapes and sizes, but the most important thing for a blogger is that the platform is fast and mobile-friendly. This is because more and more people are reading blogs on their mobile devices, so you want your blog to be easy to read on any device. If you are using a CMS or blogging platform that is not mobile-friendly, you are likely to lose readers.

Join the online community in your topic area

It’s important to join and engage with the online community on your topic because it will help you get exposure for your blog. When you engage with other people on your topic, they will see your blog and, if they like what they see, they may start following your blog and sharing your content.

Use outreach

Outreach is a great way to promote your blog and get it seen by new readers. When you undertake outreach, you send emails or DMs to influencers and other bloggers in your niche and ask them to share your blog with their audience. This is a great way to get your blog seen by a new audience and get some exposure.

If you can get an influencer to share your blog with their audience, you will get a lot of exposure. One way to get an influencer to share your blog is to guest post on their blog. This will help you get your name out there and get your blog seen by a new audience.

Grow your email list

Growing your email list is important because it will help you get more exposure for your blog. When you have a list of email subscribers, you can send them updates about your latest blog posts and they will be more likely to visit your blog and share it with their friends.

There are a lot of different ways to grow your email list, but one of the best ways is to create a hook. A hook is something that will get people interested in subscribing to your email list. For example, you could offer a free ebook or report when people subscribe to your email list.

Leverage social media

When it comes to promoting your blog, social media is still one of the best tools at your disposal. Not only is it a great way to get your blog seen by a lot of people, but it’s also a great way to get exposure for your content.

One of the best ways to use social media for promoting your blog is to engage with influencers in your topic area. When you engage with influencers, users will see your blog and, if they like what they see, they may start following your blog and sharing your content.

Make sure your content is SEO-friendly

One of the best ways to get your blog seen is to make sure your content is SEO-friendly. This means creating content that is keyword rich and optimized for the search engines. When you create SEO-friendly content, you are more likely to get found by readers who are searching for information on the web.

Work on getting referral traffic

Referral traffic is the traffic that comes to your blog from other websites. This can be a great way to get your blog seen by new readers. One way to get referral traffic is to guest post on other blogs in your niche. When you guest post, you include a link back to your blog in your author bio. This will help readers find your blog and get exposure to your content.

Be consistent

One of the best ways to get your blog seen is to be consistent with your posting schedule. This means posting new content regularly. When you are consistent with your posting schedule, you are more likely to keep readers engaged and coming back for more. One way to make sure you are consistent with your posting schedule is to set up an email outreach schedule. This will help you keep track of your blog posts and make sure you are sending out new content on a regular frequency.

Write original content

When it comes to blogging, original content is key. If you constantly rehash the same topics, your readers will get bored and may stop visiting your blog. This is why it’s important to come up with fresh, new ideas for your content.

One way to come up with new ideas for your content is to get inspired by other bloggers in your niche. Take a look at what they are writing about and see if you can add your own spin to it. Another great way to come up with new ideas is to use social media. See what people are talking about in your niche and get inspired by their conversations.

Conclusion

What makes a good blog in 2022? The answer to that question may change over time, but there are some key factors that will always be important. First and foremost, a good blog provides valuable content to its readers. This means writing about topics that people are interested in and providing information that is helpful and relevant. Second, a good blog is updated regularly. This means posting new content on a regular schedule and keeping readers engaged with fresh, new ideas. Third, a good blog is SEO-friendly. This means creating content that is keyword rich and optimized for the search engines. By following these simple tips, you can ensure that your blog is seen by the widest audience possible.

As you can see, many factors go into making a good blog. By focusing on these key elements, you can ensure that your blog is seen by as many people as possible and that your content is relevant and engaging.

seo.title: Fractional Marketing Director – 8 Critical signs that you need one
seo.description: Working with a fractional marketing director gives companies flexibility in their marketing staffing while keeping expenses low and leaving more budget for exec

body.raw:
Why a Fractional Marketing Director might be the solution to help your business reach new heights.

Introduction

Fractional marketing directors are experienced professionals who can provide the strategic vision and guidance needed to develop and execute a successful marketing plan. When it comes to marketing, businesses of all sizes can face challenges. But for small to mid-sized companies, the stakes can be especially high. Without a dedicated marketing team or leader in-house, it can be difficult to create and implement a successful marketing strategy. This is where a fractional marketing director can help.

Working with one gives a company flexibility in their marketing staffing, whilst keeping expenses low and leaving more budget for executing marketing campaigns. They can also help you manage day-to-day marketing activities and provide expert advice and support. So, if you’re looking for help with your marketing efforts, a fractional marketing director may be the answer.

Contents

  1. What is a Fractional Marketing Director and what do they do?
  2. How can they help your business?
  3. 8 signs that suggest you might need a Fractional Marketing Director
  4. The benefits of working with one
  5. Tips for working with a Fractional Marketing Director
  6. Conclusion

What is a Fractional Marketing Director and what do they do?

A fractional marketing director is a professional who can provide the strategic vision and guidance needed to develop and execute a successful marketing plan. They can help you manage day-to-day marketing activities, and provide expert advice and support. They typically have years of experience in marketing at a senior level and can provide the expertise and guidance your business needs to succeed.

How can they help your business?

A fractional marketing director can help your business in many ways. They can help you develop and execute a successful marketing strategy, manage day-to-day marketing activities, and provide expert advice and support. They can also help you save money on hiring a permanent role to leave more budget for executing marketing campaigns.

Eight signs that suggest you might need a Fractional Marketing Director:

  • You don’t have a dedicated marketing team or leader in-house.
  • You need help developing and executing a successful marketing strategy.
  • You are launching a new product or business line that requires a safe pair of hands.
  • You need a marketing expert to direct your team and instil best practices.
  • Your marketing is broken, or stuck in a rut, and needs a fresh perspective and strategic expertise.
  • You need someone to manage day-to-day marketing activities while you focus on other aspects of the business.
  • You are considering hiring a full-time marketing director but want to try out the role first.
  • Your marketing team is full of tactical specialists, but no one has the knowledge or experience to connect the sub-functions to drive results.

The benefits of working with a one

1. They can help you save money.

Hiring a fractional marketing director is a more affordable option than hiring a full-time marketing director. Fractional directors typically charge by the hour or day, which can save you money compared to hiring a full-time director. Additionally, they can help you save money on marketing campaigns and suppliers by providing expert advice and guidance.

2. They are experienced professionals.

They tend to be highly experienced professionals who have years of experience in marketing at a senior level. This means that they can provide the expertise and guidance your business needs to succeed.

3. They can provide a fresh perspective.

If your marketing is stuck in a rut, they can provide the fresh perspective and strategic expertise needed to get it back on track. They can also help you develop and execute a successful marketing strategy for a new product or business line.

4. They are flexible.

They are typically hired on a part-time or interim basis, which gives companies flexibility in their marketing staffing. This can be especially helpful for businesses that only need the presence of a marketing leader on a part-time basis.

5. They can help you manage day-to-day marketing activities.

Fractional marketing directors can help you manage day-to-day marketing activities, freeing up your time to focus on other aspects of the business. They can also provide expert advice and support, making sure that your marketing campaigns are executed successfully.

As you can see there are many benefits of working with a fractional marketing director and we go into this in more depth with fractional marketing experts in general in another article.

Tips for working with a Fractional Marketing Director

Make sure you have a clear idea of what you want.

Before you hire, make sure you have a clear idea of what you want them to do for your business. Do you need help developing and executing a marketing strategy? Are you looking for someone to manage day-to-day marketing activities? Is it creating or developing your team? Be clear about your expectations from the start so that you can find one that is a good fit for your needs.

Ask for referrals.

If you know someone who has worked with one before, ask for a referral. This can be a great way to find someone who is experienced and reputable.

Do your research.

Before you hire, be sure to do your research. Check out their website and read testimonials from past clients. You should also ask for a list of references so that you can speak to other businesses that have worked with one. Speak to at least one reference to understand how the project worked out.

Be clear about your budget.

When you are working with one, be sure to be clear about your budget. They typically charge by the hour or day, so you will need to have a clear idea of how much you are willing to spend. This will help you find someone that is a good fit for your budget. They will also want to know what budgets they will be working with so have this information to hand to save time.

Communicate regularly.

Make sure you communicate regularly. Keep them updated on your goals and objectives so that they can help you achieve them. Treat them as an advisor and use their perspective to question the way you currently operate. Additionally, be sure to give regular feedback on their work so that they can make necessary adjustments.

Conclusion

A fractional marketing director can help you to develop and execute a successful marketing strategy, freeing up your time to focus on other aspects of the business. If you’re still not sure whether or not this route is right for you, consider whether you have thought any of the following things in the last six months:

  • You’re feeling overwhelmed by your marketing efforts.
  • Your marketing strategy feels stale or outdated.
  • You’re not seeing the results you need from your marketing campaigns.
  • You don’t have time to focus on marketing, or you don’t have the resources to hire a full-time marketing director.
  • You need an objective, outside perspective on your marketing.

If any of these things sound familiar, it might be time to consider hiring one. With their help, you can take your marketing to the next level and achieve the results you’re looking for. Please contact us for more information.

About Polything

At Polything, we help companies use the power of storytelling to elevate their marketing and grow their business. Our collaborative and strategic approach to marketing can be applied to any direct-to-consumer business, and we work with clients all over the UK and further afield. Our team is experienced and passionate about helping businesses achieve their goals, and we’re always on the lookout for new and innovative ways to market products and services. If you’re interested in learning more about how we can help your business, get in touch today.

seo.title: What is business mentoring?
seo.description: Ahoy! Are you looking to take your business to the next level? Look no further than the tool of business mentoring. Read on and watch your business soar.

body.raw:
Why business mentoring matters

If you’re a business owner, you know that every decision you make can have a major impact on your success. That’s why it’s essential to have someone in your corner who can offer expert guidance and support. Business mentoring is all about finding a trusted advisor who can help you navigate the challenges and opportunities that come your way.

At its core, in the UK business mentoring is about building a relationship based on trust, respect, and mutual benefit. A good mentor can help you identify your strengths and weaknesses, set goals, and develop strategies for success. They can also offer valuable insights into industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies. It is generally agreed that both mentoring and coaching represent “ways to help people learn, change, and manage adversity…” they require a “…relationship of trust, understanding, and authenticity. And… …base their success on the ability to listen” (Carr 2016).

What Makes a Great Business Mentor?

First things first, you want someone who has been in your shoes and knows the industry inside and out. Look for a mentor who has faced similar challenges and has the experience to guide you through them. You want someone who has been there and done that and can help you navigate the sometimes rocky waters of entrepreneurship. CIPD describes a business mentoring programme as “a relationship in which a more experienced colleague shares their greater knowledge to support the development of an inexperienced member of staff. It calls on the skills of questioning, listening, clarifying and reframing that is also associated with coaching.” (CIPD “Coaching and Mentoring | Factsheets”)

But that’s not all! A great mentor is also an excellent listener who can offer constructive feedback and help you see things from a fresh perspective. They’re patient, supportive, and willing to share their knowledge and expertise to help you grow and develop.

And finally, you want a mentor who is invested in your success. You want someone who is motivated by seeing you achieve your goals and dreams, not just by the financial rewards of their mentorship.

When you find a mentor who possesses all of these qualities, you know you’ve hit the jackpot. They can help you take your business to new heights, and you’ll feel confident knowing that you have someone in your corner who believes in you and your vision.

So, don’t be afraid to do your research and take the time to find the perfect mentor for you. Trust me, it’s worth it.

The benefits of business mentoring

So, why should you consider working with a business mentor? Here are just a few of the benefits:

  • Expert guidance and support
  • Increased confidence and clarity
  • Enhanced leadership and management skills
  • Access to new networks and resources
  • Improved decision-making and problem-solving abilities

A great mentor can help you overcome obstacles, develop your skills and abilities, and achieve your goals. They can also help you build a strong, successful business that makes a real difference in the world.

Conclusion

Think about it – by finding a trusted advisor who can guide and support you, you can overcome challenges that you never thought possible. You can develop new skills and abilities that will allow you to take on new projects and expand your business in ways you never imagined.

The power of business mentoring lies in having someone by your side who has been there, done that, and can share their experience and knowledge with you. They can help you navigate tricky situations, avoid pitfalls, and make informed decisions that will positively impact your business.

And let’s not forget the emotional support that comes with having a great mentor. Starting and running a business can be a lonely and isolating experience, but with a mentor, you have someone to lean on during tough times. They can offer a listening ear, give you honest feedback, and help you stay motivated when the going gets tough.

So, whether you’re just starting out on your entrepreneurial journey or you’re looking to take your business to the next level, finding a great mentor can make all the difference. Don’t be afraid to take the leap and start searching for the perfect mentor for you. Trust me, it will be one of the best decisions you ever make. Just be aware 89% of mentees go on to be mentors in later life!

seo.description: Welcome to Your Product Value Canvas (PVC) Session You’ve already mapped your customer’s world in

body.raw:
Welcome to Your Product Value Canvas (PVC) Session

You’ve already mapped your customer’s world in the CVC interview; now we’ll zero-in on what your product or service must deliver to create real, “can’t-live-without-it” value. In the next conversation, you’ll speak with our PVC Interviewer (also voice-enabled via ElevenLabs) while the on-page chatbot organises every insight in the background. When we’re done, you’ll have a crystal-clear list of Features, Pain-Relievers, and Gain-Creators ready for the Fit Workshop.

Meet Your PVC Interviewer

Picture a product strategist with the bedside manner of a coach:

  • Starts by anchoring to the pains and gains you surfaced in the CVC.
  • Digs for the functional facts — features, workflows, proof-points.
  • Probes the “so-what?” layer: How does this remove a pain? How could it delight?
  • Summarises each block (Features ▸ Pain-Relievers ▸ Gain-Creators) so you can confirm or refine on the spot.

Quick Prep – 5 Minutes Tops

Have these notes (or rough thoughts) within reach:

  1. Top 5 product features your buyers rave about.
  2. Proof of impact: metrics, case-study wins, testimonials.
  3. Secret sauce / differentiators you’re proud of.
  4. Known constraints (lead-times, integrations, pricing quirks).
  5. Any future features you’re considering.

Don’t sweat perfect wording; raw bullets are fine — the interviewer turns them into structured canvas blocks.

Step-by-Step Instructions

Friendly Tips

  • Think benefits, not just specs — e.g., “one-click sync that saves 3 hours” is gold.
  • Stories beat bullet points: share a customer quote if you have one.
  • If a prompt feels off-target, just say so; the interviewer will pivot.
  • Say “pause” anytime you need a breather, then “resume”.
  • Keep background noise low (mute icon is top-right).

Ready?

Hit Start Interview below and let’s translate your product’s superpowers into a value map your customers can’t ignore — all in the same warm, genuine tone you know from our first session.

seo.title: Stage 3 – Value by Design™ (Lite Ed)
seo.description: Welcome to Your CVC + PVC Insight Engine This page is the quiet control room

body.raw:
Welcome to Your CVC + PVC Insight Engine

This page is the quiet control room where your two interview transcripts meet a pair of specialist AI analysts. While they cross-match customer pains with product gains and surface any gaps, you can simply keep the tab open—then collect a crisp, merged brief the moment the run completes.

(One-stop page for the two “deep-dive” analysis runs)

What happens on this page — in plain English

  1. We ingest your interview transcripts
    The raw audio + confirmed summaries from the CVC and PVC calls are pushed into a secure analysis thread that only you and our system can see. Our two researchers have been working quietly in the background, their comprehensive research will be surfaced to you with the help of our analysts.
  2. Two specialised analysts get to work
    • CVC Analyst distils customer jobs, pains, gains, and buying triggers.
    • PVC Analyst maps each product feature to the pains/gains it resolves and flags any gaps.
  3. Cross-check & merge
    A supervisor agent compares both outputs, highlights mismatches (“feature with no pain” or “pain with no feature”), and bundles everything into one tidy brief.
  4. Delivery
    As soon as the run shows Status: complete, you’ll receive an email titled “Your Fit Workshop is ready” with:
    • a copy of the deep research of each researcher
    • a PDF snapshot of both canvases
    • a link to the next (Fit Workshop) page, already pre-filled with your data.

What you need to do right now

Start CVC
Start PVC

Behind-the-scenes (for the curious)

  • Tech stack: OpenAI Assistants (or Responses API) + Agents SDK orchestrator
  • Security: PII-stripped transcripts; zero-retention mode on external calls; 256-bit-encrypted storage
  • Rate-limits & retries: The page auto-retries failed calls up to 3× with exponential back-off—no manual refresh required.

Troubleshooting

Final stop → Fit Workshop

Once you’ve got the confirmation email, head to the Fit Workshop page to prioritise which features, pains, and gains make the strongest market story. We’ll be waiting there with your freshly-minted canvases in hand.

Thanks for your patience—your insights are cooking!

seo.description: Welcome to Your Fit Workshop The heavy lifting is done—this is where our analysts help

body.raw:
Welcome to Your Fit Workshop

The heavy lifting is done—this is where our analysts help you make sense and match every customer pain to a product gain. This Workshop is where you shape the story into a market-ready promise. In about 15 minutes you’ll pick the highest-impact Jobs, Pain-Reliever/Gain-Creator pairs, land on a concise Value Proposition, and export a roadmap you can share with investors, marketers, copywriters, designers, and ad managers alike.

What You’ll Walk Away With

For each segment we have worked on together you get:

  • One-sentence Value Proposition that balances aspiration with proof.
  • Priority matrix (Must-Have → Nice-to-Have) for features and benefits.
  • Messaging starter pack— three adlibs for the highest priority job, pains and gains you should test. These are now backed by data, research and refined by you. We will also show you how to test and use them for a multitude of different purposes

Quick Prep

  1. Download the Insight Brief (pdf link above) so you can reference the full canvases.
  2. Have any team feedback or objections handy; we’ll let you log them as notes.
  3. Block a distraction-free quarter-hour—momentum matters.

Step-by-Step

Estimated runtime: 10–15 min.

Pro Tips

  • Real examples trump theory—swap in a customer quote or stat during Step 4 to boost credibility.
  • If a feature has no clear pain attached, park it in the Future quadrant; don’t let it muddy the core story.
  • Use the “Objection” sticky notes to capture internal push-back now instead of at launch.

After You Click “Finish”

  1. We save the final canvas + VP to your private dashboard.
  2. An email with the PDF and messaging pack lands in your inbox.
  3. You’ll see links to:
    • Launch Checklist (turn the VP into copy, ads, onboarding emails)
    • Workshop Bundle all your canvases, adlibs and research in one place
    • Application Bundle Ideas on how to use your value propositions in the real world
    • Feedback Loop form—tell us how the session felt and what you’ll test next.

Ready to craft a Value Proposition that sticks? Scroll down, confirm your pains & gains, and let’s lock in the story your customers have been waiting to hear.

Start Now

seo.title: Strategic Marketing Consultants – Our Approach
seo.description: An introduction to our strategic marketing consultancy model As strategic marketing consultants, the Momentum Model

body.raw:
An introduction to our strategic marketing consultancy model

As strategic marketing consultants, the Momentum Model is our primary method of engaging with clients. It is an agile, collaborative and results-focused approach to building and delivering innovative marketing programmes. The model is great for voicing consumer needs, envisioning the future and uncovering fresh insights which may have been overlooked as part of more traditional approaches. It is also useful for reframing business challenges and helping to manage change, especially cultural change. 

The Momentum Model has been based on over 20 years of practical marketing experience, and five years of experience working directly with a diverse range of direct-to-consumer organisations. Through our consultancy, we saw directly how companies struggle with scaling their marketing exponentially, whilst delivering creativity and remaining focused on serving their customers.

The Momentum Model creates the conditions where collaboration and creativity can flourish between multi-disciplinary teams, whilst incrementally improving strategy, outputs and tactical performance.

Benefits of this method

Validation beats guesswork

By collaborating across internal, external and extended teams, new perspectives and ideas can be rapidly generated and validated before deploying in the real world.

Structured approach

To successfully scale or launch a marketing programme, firstly, all stakeholders have to be confident in the insight, methodology and approach. We used ‘tested in the wild’ frameworks, methods, tools and playbooks to design an engagement specifically for your needs. Collaboration ensures that everyone in your team has been on the same journey.

Unexpected benefits

Giving your teams a common language to articulate your business, its issues, and solutions across product, marketing, sales and operations have unexpected upsides. We see time and again, that although this method is broadly a marketing process, teams will discover and solve business-critical issues across product, development, culture and training within your organisation. They will also find new opportunities in these areas too.

Training and iterative learning

Through the engagement, the team will learn a common language, ways of describing both business and consumer needs, as well as its problems and challenges. They will become well versed in a variety of strategic frameworks that can be used in the future and that will eventually become part of your company culture. When stakeholders continue to share their journey with their teams, the method will become ingrained in your business, realising benefits and new ideas for years to come.

Business agility

Marketing and business practice has moved on from traditional ‘waterfall’ planning and delivery cycles. This model gives your business the ability to refine strategy, innovate, and manage tactical delivery simultaneously. The framework will give you the ability to adapt to market changes, new consumer trends as well as wider macro forces.

A collaborative model for scaling marketing results

Inject your business with fresh perspectives, insight and new ideas on how to best serve your customers in the future. Elevated marketing results rarely occur in the context of the same stakeholders sitting in a meeting room day in and day out. Delivering and scaling award-winning marketing programmes now requires collaboration skills and the co-creation of a killer strategy that will resonate with consumers in an attention-deficit world.

Exploration
Collaboration
Experimentation
Implementation

While our approach, methods and tools work for any size of direct to consumer business, in any industry, we treat each engagement as unique.

Depending on the situation, we can bring in experts, influencers, consumers or users to the process to bring fresh perspectives and ideas to your product or problem. Or, we can simply guide your team through a set of frameworks and give you the right tools to do the job at hand.

In each engagement, we prepare a bespoke programme based on our initial discovery session. We then facilitate a process to suit your exact needs. Each element will be designed to deliver actionable insight from day one, and a robust strategy at the end of the engagement. In addition, participants will enjoy a hands-on learning experience, and be able to use the outcomes of each session to incrementally improve products, marketing and business processes.

Contact Us

Is your brand truly distinctive?

Many brands struggle to carve out a unique space in their market. Your brand’s unique value proposition should be a shining beacon, not a distant glimmer.

Our diagnostic tool measures how well your brand establishes a unique emotional connection maintains consistency across all touchpoints, and adapts to market changes—all the while staying true to its core identity.

Dare to find out the truth with our Distinctive Brand Index assessment. The results might surprise you!

Take the Assessment

Our Founder

Chris has over twenty years of experience in marketing across, media, startups and scale-up businesses. He has led multi-disciplinary teams in marketing, development and monetisation as well as bringing together teams across Europe to work effectively on consumer-based marketing strategy.

He has also led brand marketing activations for clients such as Ford, Three, EE, Jeep, HTC, Casio, British Airways, Lastminute, Nintendo & BMW.

Giving back is a big priority for Chris; he mentors on the Digital Boost platform as well as the Help to Grow programme and is currently studying with the ILM for a Certificate and Diploma in Effective Coaching and Mentoring.

He is also a Leadership qualified Trustee, a member of ILM, ABM, and an Advisor and strategist for UK Business Advisors.

document.title: Claim your free strategy session – Book a call

seo.title: Claim your free strategy session – Book a call
seo.description: Book a free 30-minute strategy session We obsess about all things marketing strategy and would

body.raw:
Book a free 30-minute strategy session

We obsess about all things marketing strategy and would love to talk about how our Momentum model will help your business achieve a better product-market fit, get more consistent results and a better return on your marketing spend.

During your free phone consultation, we will discuss the following:

  • How to quickly spot gaps in your marketing efforts.
  • How to align your product more closely to consumer needs.
  • How to create a clear value proposition that resonates with consumers.
  • How to easily implement the core frameworks to scale your marketing and business.
  • How to create a strategic marketing model to catapult revenue and increase return on investment.

It is a 100% free no-obligation, no strings attached consultation. Just pick a date and time that works for you and confirm your session.

Beth Mawdsley
08:50 24 Apr 25
Chris changed my ways of working tremendously during our coaching sessions. Every barrier I was facing Chris found solutions that were easy to implement and use moving forward.
We had great discussions every session and Chris always picked up on little details in what I was saying and was able to find the most amazing information to send over which I not only found useful for myself but was also able to share with my colleagues who also found the information very useful. In all honesty I didn't want my sessions with Chris to end! I started our sessions with low confidence and a bit of a mess in my head as to the structure of my working day and I came out with clear plans and strategies thanks to Chris. I highly recommend Chris's coaching sessions. Thank you so much!
Thomas Graham
15:37 01 Aug 24
I was allocated coaching sessions by my access to work assessor, but I did not know what to expect and came to this process open-minded. Chris made me feel comfortable from the first session and I have learned a lot from him over the past 6 months. I feel more confident in my role and appreciate all the work that we have done together. I will take the skills and tools into my daily practice. Thank you for all you have done for me over the past 6 months
Anurah Farrell
15:13 15 Apr 24
Chris was very helpful in helping me understand how I could re-target exiting potential prospects and diagnosing if my FB Ads Manager Account was set up correctly. Thank you!
Ben Cosbie Ross
19:17 09 Apr 24
I was introduced to Chris via work. The coach coachee relationship is the key element to make the sessions work and from the start of the very first session Chris made it very easy. My reservations were around a formulaic lesson by lesson method but Chris worked with me to get the best outcomes. Chris was able to provide insight in multiple areas, often within a very short window, and with zero preparation. The sessions were conversational, which, was exactly what worked for me. Every session was beneficial and it was a shame when our sessions ended. I am very confident in recommending Chris to anyone who is thinking about engaging an ND coach. Chris is thoughtful, genuine and empathetic and is an outstanding coach.
Benoit Collin
11:01 18 Mar 24
I had the pleasure of having multiple mentoring sessions with Chris, and his guidance was pivotal in refining my start-up idea, identifying our target persona, and establishing a clear customer value proposition. Anyone looking to grow their business would greatly benefit from his mentorship/expertise. Highly recommended!
Jay Maniar
15:35 27 Apr 23
I booked a mentoring session with Chris who was brilliant at walking me through the complex world of Facebook advertising. Really patient and generous with his knowledge.
Ellora Coupe
09:17 21 Mar 23
The mentoring I have received as a small business entrepreneur has been invaluable. Chris has helped me to understand new opportunities, how to focus on bringing value to my customers and provided a huge amount of support in getting my business launched and off the ground. It has proven to me the huge value in mentoring that small businesses can benefit from.
jon draper
17:02 25 Jan 23
Spoke with Chris today. He is personable and clearly knows more about the subject than I could ever learn. Despite this he kept it simple and relevant. Really helping me get an understanding of what is necessary to start my SEO journey.
Ellie Good
14:01 28 Nov 22
My SEO session with Chris was incredibly informative, with advice and suggestions tailored for my level of understanding. I now have a clear idea of what needs to be done to improve the areas in question. Thank you!
Don Magrane
14:57 03 Nov 22
Spent some time with Chris discussing our PPC, audience targeting and content strategy. Incredibly useful. We have plenty of targeted action points to work on for the mid to long term which will be very helpful for our business.
Thalia Shaw
10:14 18 Oct 22
Chris is a very experience marketing and digital marketing expert with so much knowledge. I had a very interesting and insightful 60 minute session with him with practical actions to put in place in my business.
Gilly Thompson
15:10 14 Oct 22
Chris, is a font of all marketing and digital marketing knowlegde.

I learnt more about digital marketing in 20 minutes with Chris than i did in 3 years!!

I am now doing reels on insta with view of between £5k - £12k

Incredible, he is supportive and has brilliant ideas for generate brand awareness, loyalty and sales
Daniel Johnson
05:34 11 Oct 22
During our 60-min problem-solving call Chris was able to provide a series of well-informed, practical and realistic suggestions on possible next steps for our business.
Book a call

Can’t wait? Then give us a call now on: +44 208 0640312

Book a call

body.raw:
Struggling to make progress with your business?

Meet polything mentoring and coaching

Discover the path to a happier and healthier business.

Book a call to see if we are a fit

Speak with an accredited coach and mentor today.

  • Free discovery call – Zero commitment
  • Professional engagements for you, or your team
  • Payment options available

Accreditations & Memberships

Selected
Clients

Empower your business with accredited business mentoring and coaching

Book a call

Personalised support for both neurodiverse and neuro-typical founders and business owners to achieve their full potential.

Discover how Polything’s business mentoring and coaching services provide personalised support tailored to your unique challenges. Our engagements are designed to help neurodiverse founders and business owners overcome challenges and achieve success with confidence, but equally help neuro-typical people too.

Customer Reviews

” Mentoring really helped me break down some issues and pinpoint the causes.

Gave me lots of ideas to consider and a different perspective of the products we offer. This was my first time using a mentor and he made me feel welcome and was very friendly. “

– Kristina Stazaker, Managing Director at Out of the Ashes Ltd
Beth Mawdsley
08:50 24 Apr 25
Chris changed my ways of working tremendously during our coaching sessions. Every barrier I was facing Chris found solutions that were easy to implement and use moving forward.
We had great discussions every session and Chris always picked up on little details in what I was saying and was able to find the most amazing information to send over which I not only found useful for myself but was also able to share with my colleagues who also found the information very useful. In all honesty I didn't want my sessions with Chris to end! I started our sessions with low confidence and a bit of a mess in my head as to the structure of my working day and I came out with clear plans and strategies thanks to Chris. I highly recommend Chris's coaching sessions. Thank you so much!
Thomas Graham
15:37 01 Aug 24
I was allocated coaching sessions by my access to work assessor, but I did not know what to expect and came to this process open-minded. Chris made me feel comfortable from the first session and I have learned a lot from him over the past 6 months. I feel more confident in my role and appreciate all the work that we have done together. I will take the skills and tools into my daily practice. Thank you for all you have done for me over the past 6 months
Anurah Farrell
15:13 15 Apr 24
Chris was very helpful in helping me understand how I could re-target exiting potential prospects and diagnosing if my FB Ads Manager Account was set up correctly. Thank you!
Ben Cosbie Ross
19:17 09 Apr 24
I was introduced to Chris via work. The coach coachee relationship is the key element to make the sessions work and from the start of the very first session Chris made it very easy. My reservations were around a formulaic lesson by lesson method but Chris worked with me to get the best outcomes. Chris was able to provide insight in multiple areas, often within a very short window, and with zero preparation. The sessions were conversational, which, was exactly what worked for me. Every session was beneficial and it was a shame when our sessions ended. I am very confident in recommending Chris to anyone who is thinking about engaging an ND coach. Chris is thoughtful, genuine and empathetic and is an outstanding coach.
Benoit Collin
11:01 18 Mar 24
I had the pleasure of having multiple mentoring sessions with Chris, and his guidance was pivotal in refining my start-up idea, identifying our target persona, and establishing a clear customer value proposition. Anyone looking to grow their business would greatly benefit from his mentorship/expertise. Highly recommended!
Jay Maniar
15:35 27 Apr 23
I booked a mentoring session with Chris who was brilliant at walking me through the complex world of Facebook advertising. Really patient and generous with his knowledge.
Ellora Coupe
09:17 21 Mar 23
The mentoring I have received as a small business entrepreneur has been invaluable. Chris has helped me to understand new opportunities, how to focus on bringing value to my customers and provided a huge amount of support in getting my business launched and off the ground. It has proven to me the huge value in mentoring that small businesses can benefit from.
jon draper
17:02 25 Jan 23
Spoke with Chris today. He is personable and clearly knows more about the subject than I could ever learn. Despite this he kept it simple and relevant. Really helping me get an understanding of what is necessary to start my SEO journey.
Ellie Good
14:01 28 Nov 22
My SEO session with Chris was incredibly informative, with advice and suggestions tailored for my level of understanding. I now have a clear idea of what needs to be done to improve the areas in question. Thank you!
Don Magrane
14:57 03 Nov 22
Spent some time with Chris discussing our PPC, audience targeting and content strategy. Incredibly useful. We have plenty of targeted action points to work on for the mid to long term which will be very helpful for our business.
Thalia Shaw
10:14 18 Oct 22
Chris is a very experience marketing and digital marketing expert with so much knowledge. I had a very interesting and insightful 60 minute session with him with practical actions to put in place in my business.
Gilly Thompson
15:10 14 Oct 22
Chris, is a font of all marketing and digital marketing knowlegde.

I learnt more about digital marketing in 20 minutes with Chris than i did in 3 years!!

I am now doing reels on insta with view of between £5k - £12k

Incredible, he is supportive and has brilliant ideas for generate brand awareness, loyalty and sales
Daniel Johnson
05:34 11 Oct 22
During our 60-min problem-solving call Chris was able to provide a series of well-informed, practical and realistic suggestions on possible next steps for our business.
Business Mentoring Benefits

Fast-track your business progress

Direct access to a qualified mentor with a track record of growing businesses.

Unique growth plans tailored to your specific business goals and challenges.

Soundboard your ideas with a trusted mentor

Hands-on support with regular check-ins and on-demand guidance.

Access to an extensive library of marketing resources, tools, and templates

Get clear on your path to success

Custom growth plans and strategies uniquely tailored to your business.

Hands-On Guidance – real-time support for immediate challenges.

Networking opportunities and shared learning experiences.

Our business mentoring packages

Getting Started

Typical Duration: 3 Months
Sessions: 5 sessions, 60 minutes.

This package is designed to kick-start your journey towards change. We’ll cover goal setting, identifying obstacles, creating a plan of action, and building resilience to manage setbacks

  • Session handouts
  • Email support between sessions
  • Access to our online resource hub


Who it’s for: Anyone who wants to commit to changing their business or work life, but has been unable to do it independently.

£1,450 +VAT

Progress Plan

Duration: 5-7 Months
Sessions: 8 sessions, 90 minutes.

This is our most popular package and is all about maintaining momentum and making consistent progress. We’ll focus on refining your strategy, enhancing your skills, overcoming challenges, and celebrating achievements.

  • Session handouts
  • Email support between sessions
  • Ad hoc Slack/Whatsapp check-ins
  • Access to our online resource hub


Who it’s for: Ideal for those entrepreneurs who have started their journey towards change and are looking for sustained support and regular check-ins to keep them on track.

£1,900 +VAT

Signature Plan

Duration: 7-9 Months
Sessions: 11 sessions, 90 minutes.

This comprehensive package is designed to facilitate deep, lasting change. We’ll delve into advanced strategies for overcoming obstacles, enhancing performance, and maintaining progress. We’ll also focus on personal development, leadership skills, and work-life balance.

  • Session handouts
  • Email support between sessions
  • A personalised action plan
  • Ad hoc Slack/Whatsapp check-ins
  • Access to our online resource hub

Who it’s for: This package is for business owners committed to significantly changing their career or business and ready to invest time and effort into their personal and professional growth. If you recognise that the change you want to make requires significant commitment, this package is for you.

£2,499 +VAT

GET IN TOUCH

Book a call

Video Case Studies

Try our momentum assessment to gain clarity on your strengths

Are you ready to find clarity on your greatest business strengths?

Alignment

Is your business model working with your brain or fighting it?

Clarity

Do you know what to focus on next, or are you spinning too many plates?

Momentum

How consistently are you moving forward without burning out?

Get your free assessment now
Business mentoring process

How it works

Step 1 – Contact Us

Schedule a free consultation to discuss your needs. We will explain more about the process and start to tailor a plan just for you.

Step 2 – Choose your preferred plan

Book your preferred plan around your commitments. Join a discovery call where we will discuss your goals and challenges in detail and start to plan.

Step 3 – Achieve Results

Join the sessions, undertake your actions and watch your business grow with our tailored support.

What is included

  • Flexibility –  Sessions and support tailored to your schedule. We work around your business, not the other way around.
  • Customised Growth Plan – A strategy uniquely tailored to your business goals and challenges.
  • Resource Library Access –  An extensive collection of marketing resources, tools, and templates.
  • Personalised Mentoring Sessions – Direct access to an expert marketer and qualified mentor with a track record of scaling businesses.
  • Hands-On Support – Regular check-ins and on-demand support for real-time guidance.
  • Community Access – Membership in an exclusive community of entrepreneurs and startups.

Additional Benefits

  • Guaranteed Results – If you don’t see tangible progress and growth in your business during the sessions, we will offer additional support sessions at no extra cost.
  • Zero Risk – The first session is free with no obligation to continue. Experience the value firsthand before making a decision.
  • Flexibility –  Sessions and support tailored to your schedule. We work around your business, not the other way around.

GET IN TOUCH

Take control of your business

Book a call

Association Memberships

Business Mentoring FAQs

What is business mentoring?

Business mentoring involves experienced professionals providing guidance and support to help business owners develop their skills, make informed decisions, and achieve their business goals. Find out more about what business mentoring is and more helpfully, it isn’t.

What skills should a good mentor have?

A good mentor should possess strong communication skills, active listening, empathy, patience, problem-solving abilities, and a deep understanding of the business landscape. Additionally, they should be able to provide constructive feedback, inspire and motivate, and maintain confidentiality.

How do I find a good business mentor?

Look for mentors with relevant experience, a strong track record, and a mentoring style that aligns with your needs. Networking events, professional associations (such as the ABM), and online platforms can help you connect with potential mentors. We have created this handy article to help you choose the right mentor for you.

How much do business mentors charge in the UK?

Business mentor rates in the UK can vary widely, typically ranging from £50 to £300+ per hour, depending on the mentor’s experience and expertise.

What is the difference between a business advisor and a business mentor?

A business advisor provides specific advice on business operations and strategy, while a business mentor offers broader guidance, support, and personal development.

Are business mentors worth it?

We are biased, but having experienced being a mentor and mentee, yes, business mentors can provide valuable insights, support, and connections that can significantly impact a business’s growth and success. Find out more about the benefits of business mentoring.

What is the difference between a business coach and a business mentor?

A business coach focuses on specific skills and performance, often with a structured approach, while a business mentor provides broader, more holistic guidance and support

What are the 3 types of mentoring?

Traditional Mentoring: One-on-one guidance from a mentor.
Group Mentoring: A mentor works with several mentees simultaneously.
Peer Mentoring: Colleagues or peers at similar levels mentor each other.

What can a business mentor do for you?

A business mentor can provide insights, feedback, connections, and support, helping you to make informed decisions and accelerate your business growth.

What are the 5 pillars of mentorship?

Trust: Building a reliable relationship.
Respect: Mutual regard for each other’s experience and insights.
Support: Providing emotional and professional support.
Guidance: Offering direction and advice.
Accountability: Ensuring goals are set and achieved

What should a mentor not do?

A mentor should not impose their solutions, breach confidentiality, or neglect the mentoring relationship.

What is a small business mentor?

A small business mentor provides personalised guidance, support, and advice to help small business owners overcome challenges and achieve their goals.

Finding it hard to scale your marketing outPut?

Transform Your Business with Craft Marketing Services

A single subscription service for all your creative and marketing needs.

Book a call to see if we are a fit

Let’s build you a predictable marketing machine.

  • Free discovery call – Zero commitment
  • We work with and around your existing team
  • Flexible subscription tiers tailored to your needs

Review and Ratings

Polything
5.0
Based on 18 reviews
powered by Google

Craft Marketing Services – Designed for growing businesses

Perfect for both established businesses and smaller companies looking to kick-start their marketing activities.

Craft offers scalable solutions to meet your evolving needs. In order to maintain a high standard of service for our clients, we limit the number of Craft subscriptions available, ensuring personalised attention and bespoke solutions for each client we work with.

If you don’t see a measurable improvement in your marketing performance within the first three months, we offer a complimentary strategy reassessment to realign your goals and strategy. 

Sign up for Craft today and receive a bonus marketing strategy session, where we’ll outline key steps to galvanise your marketing journey.

Book a call

What our customers say

“I would highly recommend them!!”

“They transformed the way we look at our online presence from the design of our site to our social media and content presence. Chris is an absolute pleasure to work with, extremely knowledgeable and has worked seamlessly with our team to make the necessary changes within our online offering.”

– Jon Case
CEO at SSS Learning Ltd

“Their wealth of experience was the deciding factor.”

“WOLF brought in more than 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch. Polything assisted with a serious chunk of that due to the campaigns they worked on, and the creative and operational work they did to assist our MENA regionally-led influencer marketing campaigns that brought in the rest. I was very grateful to Polything.”

– Adam Gold
CCO at WOLF Live

“A huge impact on our business…”

“His work on our branded content proposition, productisation and social has transformed the way we look at monetising content. He has become a highly regarded part of the team and his knowledge, creativity, innovation and ingenuity have been invaluable in helping to develop our business.”

– Chris Dicker
CEO at Candr Media Group

Marketing Services Subscription Benefits

Comprehensive Services

An all-in-one solution for your creative and marketing needs. We start with your needs to develop bespoke solutions, rather than offering pre-packaged services.

Starting from scratch? No problem, we’ll help define what you need to build out a full programme of marketing activity. 

Work with a team of experienced marketing professionals and creatives dedicated to your brand’s success.

Tailored Solutions

Our solutions are customisable to fit your specific marketing goals. Think of us as an extension of your team, working with you to define and deliver your personalised marketing plan.

Craft is priced to offer maximum value, providing top-tier marketing services at a predictable, fixed cost. It’s an investment in your brand’s growth, designed to be accessible for businesses of all sizes, with no hidden costs.

Scalable Support

As your business grows, Craft grows with you, offering scalable solutions and add-ons that adapt to your changing needs. We understand that things change and evolve over time, and so as they do, we bring new specialists into your team as your knowledge and results grow.

Access expertise at your fingertips, with our team of creatives and marketing experts, bringing years of experience and innovative strategies to your brand.

Book a call

Case Studies

BLACKRIVER RAMPS

Black Friday / Cyber Monday Campaign – 22% increase in revenue compared to the previous year, and a 14.55 ROAS.

Explore

WOLF

The Worlds Online Festival – 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch.

Explore

BLUEFORT

Explore how we refined Bluefort Security’s marketing with CRAFT and drove success.

Explore
Types of Creative and Marketing Services

Creative Production Services

  • Design – Professional graphic design services tailored to your brand.
  • Video – High-quality video production to engage your audience.
  • Animation – Creative animations to bring your ideas to life.
  • Copywriting – Compelling copy that resonates with your target audience.
  • Photography – Stunning visuals to enhance your brand’s presence.
  • Project Management – Seamless project execution from start to finish.

Marketing Services

  • PPC (Pay-Per-Click) – Effective ad campaigns to drive traffic and sales.
  • SEO (Search Engine Optimisation) – Boost your online visibility and rankings.
  • Campaign Planning – Tactical planning for impactful marketing campaigns.
  • Paid Media -Targeted advertising to reach your ideal customers.
  • Brief Creation – Crafting detailed briefs to ensure successful project outcomes.
  • Tendering – Managing the tendering process for collaborations with other third parties.
Our Subscription Tiers

Essentials

Typical Hours of Work: 50 hours per month
Givens: A dedicated Project Manager

This package is designed to kickstart your marketing journey. We provide foundational marketing services to establish and strengthen your brand presence. Perfect for businesses needing an initial setup and quick wins.

This plan includes the standard creative service list which includes; design, video production, copywriting, and more to set your marketing efforts in motion.

  • A dedicated project manager
  • An on-demand creative team
  • Turnaround times from 10 hours
  • Unlimited stakeholders and asset storage
  • Standard creative service list


Who it’s for: Startups and smaller established businesses needing initial setup and quick wins with basic marketing needs.

£5,000 per month

Growth

Typical Hours of Work: 80 hours per month
Givens: A dedicated Project Manager

This is our most popular package and is all about maintaining momentum and making consistent progress. Ideal for businesses seeking sustained support.

It includes all services from the Essentials, plus extra marketing consultancy to troubleshoot any issues you have with campaigns as well as access to our specialist marketing team to manage campaigns.

  • A dedicated project manager
  • An on-demand creative team
  • An on-demand marketing team
  • Turnaround times from 10 hours
  • Unlimited stakeholders and asset storage
  • Standard service list
  • Marketing consulting
  • Priority support


Who it’s for: Established businesses ready to scale who are in need of sustained support, advanced strategies, and regular engagement.

£7,500 per month

Fully Comp

Typical Hours of Work: 120 hours per month
Givens: A dedicated Project Manager

This comprehensive package is designed for clients who need extensive support and advanced marketing solutions. They may also need a higher level of production values in their video output.

This plan includes all services from the Growth, plus access to strategy consultancy, and our extended service list which includes; premium video production, adnaced animation, motion design, AR/3D design and additional project management.

  • A dedicated project manager
  • An on-demand creative team
  • An on-demand marketing team
  • Turnaround times from 10 hours
  • Unlimited stakeholders and asset storage
  • Extended service list
  • Marketing consulting
  • Strategy consulting

Who it’s for: Ambitious scaling businesses committed to comprehensive, long-term marketing solutions and significant growth.

£10,000 per month

GET IN TOUCH

Book a call

How it works

Step 1 – Subscribe

Choose a subscription plan that fits your needs.

Our subscription model offers flexibility and scalability to support your growth.

Step 2 – Implement

Our team executes your marketing plan meticulously.

We’ll kick off with a comprehensive onboarding session to understand your business goals.

Our team of experts will then start working on your marketing activities, handling everything from creative production to digital marketing campaigns with precision and care.

Step 3 – Grow

Watch your business thrive with consistent and high-quality marketing support. Get regular updates and reports on your marketing campaigns and creative output.

Enjoy continuous support and guidance from our experienced professionals to ensure your marketing efforts remain effective and aligned with your business goals.

Craft Marketing Services

What is included

  • Expertise at Your Fingertips – Access to a team of creatives and marketing experts, bringing years of experience and innovative strategies to your brand.
  • Design Services – Enhance your brand with professional graphic design.
  • Photography – Boost your brand’s presence with stunning visuals.
  • Video Production – Engage your audience with high-quality video content
  • Copywriting – Craft compelling content that resonates with your target audience.
  • Brief Creation – Detailed briefs to ensure successful projects.
  • A Dedicated Project Manager – Direct access to an expert project manager who will be your champion. Seamless project execution from start to finish is included in every tier of service.
  • Campaign Planning – Detailed planning for impactful marketing campaigns.
  • Paid Media – Targeted advertising to reach your ideal customers.
  • Content Marketing – Tailored content strategies to engage and convert your audience.
  • PPC & SEO – Reviews and analysis, managed services as a bolt-on.

Additional Benefits

  • Easy to Get Started – Speak to us to see if we are a good fit. Then you can co-design a package with us that meets your needs.
  • Satisfaction Guarantee – If you don’t see a measurable improvement in your marketing outcomes within the first three months, we offer a complimentary strategy reassessment to realign with your goals.
  • Predictable Investment – Fixed pricing takes the guesswork out of budgeting for marketing making it easier to plan and invest in your growth.
  • Affordability – Craft is priced to offer maximum value, providing top-tier marketing services at a predictable, fixed cost. It’s an investment in your brand’s growth, designed to be accessible for businesses of all sizes.
  • Flexibility –  Sessions and support tailored to your schedule. We work around your business, not the other way around.
  • Exclusive Access – We have no ambitions of becoming an agency. Our limited availability ensures that each Craft client receives the focused, dedicated support they deserve.
Get in Touch

Marketing Services FAQs

How much should I pay for marketing services?

The cost varies depending on the type of services that you need. As a rough guide you could expect to spend between the following according to Clutch’s Insights (data last updated May 2024):
– PPC Services £1,000-£10,000+ per month depending on your media budget
– SEO Services an average of less than £7,800 per month for most businesses
– Social Media Services including paid an average of less than £7,800 per month for most businesses
– Design Services between £10,000 and £40,000 per project
– Marketing Strategy Services – £10,000 and £40,000 per project

How much does a marketing plan cost in the UK?

A comprehensive marketing plan in the UK typically costs between £2,000 and £9,000, depending on the complexity and scope of the project.

Is it worth paying a marketing services company?

We are biased, but yes, paying a marketing company can be worth it for the expertise, time savings, and potential ROI they can provide, especially if you lack in-house marketing capabilities.

Why is marketing so expensive?

Marketing can be expensive due to the need for skilled professionals, extensive research, multiple channels, and the continuous effort required to maintain and optimise campaigns.

What is a reasonable marketing budget for a small business?

A reasonable marketing budget for a small business typically ranges from 5% to 10% of total revenue, depending on growth goals and industry standards.

What is the average marketing budget in the UK?

The average marketing budget in the UK varies by industry but generally falls between 5% and 15% of a company’s total revenue. According to YouGov the average was 9.33% of annual revenue in 2019.

What is a reasonable amount to spend on marketing?

A reasonable amount to spend on marketing is around 7-8% of your total revenue, though this can vary based on your sector and specific business needs and goals.

What is a typical marketing budget for a startup?

Startups typically allocate between 12% and 20% of their revenue to marketing to build brand awareness and drive initial growth. According to HubSpot the average was 11.2% of revenue at the end of 2022

Is there a satisfaction guarantee?

Yes, if you don’t see tangible growth within a set period, we offer additional support sessions at no extra cost.

How can I contact Polything?

Via email at contact@polything.co.uk or phone at +44 208 0640312.

seo.title: Marketing Consultancy Services
seo.description: Selected Clients Where marketing meets innovation, to bring strategy to life Discover Polything s comprehensive range

body.raw:
Selected Clients

Where marketing meets innovation,
to bring strategy to life

Discover Polything’s comprehensive range of strategic marketing consultancy services, designed to help your business grow and succeed. Our tailored range of services has been developed to ensure that your marketing efforts are effective, helping your brand out in competitive markets.

Services Overview

Marketing Strategy Services

Comprehensive strategies – Let us help you develop a holistic marketing plan encompassing all aspects of your brand’s growth. Our strategies are designed to elevate your brand and deliver measurable results through thorough market analysis and strategic implementation.

We go at your pace, either delivering intensive engagements over 2-3 months or spreading strategy development over an extended period to fit your needs.

Expert-led workshops – Benefit from our interactive workshops that provide deep insights into market trends, customer behaviour, and effective marketing tactics. These sessions equip you with the knowledge and skills to implement successful marketing strategies.

Actionable insights reports – Receive detailed reports with clear, actionable recommendations to improve your marketing efforts. These reports are based on comprehensive analysis and are tailored to your business context.

Learn More

Craft Creative & Marketing Services

Realise your brand vision with our marketing and creative production services, including design, video, animation, and more. Our team works closely with you to ensure each project reflects your brand’s unique identity and message.

Holistic approach – Integrate Craft seamlessly with your existing team to ensure consistency and impact across all channels, from initial concept to final execution.

Custom projects – Whether you require a single asset or a comprehensive marketing programme, our service is scalable to meet your needs and deliver high-quality results.

Subscription-based – Access a range of creative and marketing services through a fixed-price subscription model designed to scale with your business needs.

Learn More

Business Mentoring and Coaching

Engage in one-on-one sessions with an accredited business mentor to refine your business skills and strategy. These sessions focus on leveraging your strengths, overcoming challenges, and creating actionable plans to achieve your goals.

Custom growth plans – We will co-develop a bespoke growth plan tailored to your specific business objectives, helping you navigate the complexities of scaling and enhancing your market presence.

Support for Neurodivergent Founders – Specialised mentoring designed to address the unique challenges faced by neurodiverse business owners, fostering an inclusive and supportive growth environment.

Learn More

Polything offers a holistic approach to your marketing challenges, ensuring every aspect of your strategy is covered from planning to execution. Our founder, Chris, brings a wealth of experience and a personal touch to every project, ensuring your business receives the attention it deserves.

Download our services guide

Download

Free download, no email required.

What our customers say

“I would highly recommend them!!”

“They transformed the way we look at our online presence from the design of our site to our social media and content presence. Chris is an absolute pleasure to work with, extremely knowledgeable and has worked seamlessly with our team to make the necessary changes within our online offering.”

– Jon Case
CEO at SSS Learning Ltd

“Their wealth of experience was the deciding factor.”

“WOLF brought in more than 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch. Polything assisted with a serious chunk of that due to the campaigns they worked on, and the creative and operational work they did to assist our MENA regionally-led influencer marketing campaigns that brought in the rest. I was very grateful to Polything.”

– Adam Gold
